item.title: The United Nations and International Economic Relations
item.description: Strange, Susan. “The United Nations and International Economic Relations.” In The Evolving United Nations: A Prospect for Peace?, edited by Kenneth J. Twitchet, 100-119. London: Europa Publications for the David Davies Memorial Institute of International Studies, 1971. Contrasting a Unitarian (‘one-world’) or egalitarian vision of the United Nations mission with a reformist position, Strange argues that despite some early hopes that the UN might remake the global economy, its subsequent history has revealed it to be largely powerless over much of international economic relations.
